description: A busy bridge swarming with iron-clad foes. Be prepared to engage in an array of melee, ranged and artillery attacks or attempt to push past them
name: Bridge Of Sacrifice

description: Church of Elleh is a ruined building that hides a Site of Grace. The rooftop has caved in and offers no protection from the elements, and weeds are overtaking the walls, but this doesn't stop merchants from seeking what little shelter is on offer
name: Church Of Elleh

description: Catacombs filled with the stench of death, Skeletons dwell in the shadows
name: Deathtouched Catacombs

description: The dilapidated remains of the Church of Dragon Communion showcase the ruin that came to the land. But could a flame still linger at its altar??
name: Church Of Dragon Communion

description: Coastal Cave is a dark opening on the side of a cliff. Its mossy depths are overrun by hostile humanoid creatures, but those who brave it may find passage to new lands
name: Coastal Cave

description: Dragon-Burnt Ruins are what remains of the housing area among Agheel Lake, long lost to the deadly attacks of the fierce Agheel Dragon
name: Dragon-burnt Ruins

description: The southern Evergaol of Limgrave, before the entrance to Weeping Peninsula
name: Forlorn Hound Evergaol

description: Fingefolk Hero's Grave is a dark and secluded location within the Cave of Knowledge. The confused and aimless dwell within
name: Fringefolk Hero's Grave

description: The overrun fort of Kenneth Haith, the alleged next ruler of Limgrave
name: Fort Haight

description: Closed with a giant set of doors. It looks like you need some pieces to interact with the tower.
name: Divine Tower Of Limgrave

description: Gatefront Ruins is what remains of the now destroyed barracks near the fortification. Despite its poor state, it is a heavily guarded location by those loyal to Stormveil
name: Gatefront Ruins

description: Limgrave Tunnels are a mine harvested for Glimstone. Its zealous miners don't dare venture into its hidden chambers, for fear of the hoarder Troll within
name: Limgrave Tunnels

description: Groveside Cave is a small refuge for wildlife in Limgrave. Its proximity to water and ease of access make it a sought-after shelter against bad weather, but those who venture in don't seem to return
name: Groveside Cave

description: Easily distiguished from the rest of the trees in Mistwood Forest.
name: Minor Erdtree (mistwood)

description: A cave that houses a tomb, deep within. It is situated at the northmost part of Limgrave. It has been inhabited by a pack of Wolves, Land Octopuses, and Giant Bats
name: Highroad Cave

description: Mistwood is a Location in Elden Ring. The Mistwood region is located in the Eastern part of Limgrave. Tiered terrain, small beaches, and luscious forests occupied by Lesser Runebears are the defining features of this region.
name: Mistwood

description: Concealed by the thriving growth of vegetation, these ruins are kept out of sight by the veil of nature itself. But there's more to it than what you see
name: Mistwood Ruins

description: An underground cemetery that is located at the north-east side of Agheel Lake in Limgrave. Once a place for peaceful rest for fallen heroes, it is now infested by goblins.
name: Murkwater Catacombs

description: A dark cave halfway through the Murkwater River
name: Murkwater Cave

description: A mystical underground region filled with its own set of skies and stars. Beware, it is teeming with creatures big and small alike
name: Siofra River Well

description: The Last Church in Limgrave before reaching Caelid
name: Smoldering Church

description: The Stormgate is a heavily guarded area that marks the border within Limgrave and Stormhill. Only the foolhardy would rush such against such odds
name: Stormgate

description: Stormfoot Catacombs were meant as a restful place for the deceased, but its now overrun by Goblins. Its deepest secrets are secured by the Guardian of the Burial Tree
name: Stormfoot Catacombs

description: Stormhill is a Location in Elden Ring. Stormhill is the upper half area of Limgrave, between its central river and Stormveil.
name: Stormhill

description: The Brave and Foolish alike dare venture into the Stormhill Evergaol and face its relentless knight in battle
name: Stormhill Evergaol

description: The Stormhill Shack is a dilapidated shelter formerly used to house hunters in the area. A Site of Grace offers a needed moment of rest for those traveling nearby
name: Stormhill Shack

description: Stranded Graveyard is a dark and secluded location within the Cave of Knowledge. The confused and aimless dwell within
name: Stranded Graveyard

description: D, Hunter of The Dead, warns you of this nearby village taken over by death, known as Summonwater Village
name: Summonwater Village

description: The Ruins of an Old Church found in the Mistwood. The most prominent sight here is a statue of a lady with her arms outstretched
name: Third Church Of Marika

description: Small shack in a remote area near north-central Stormhill.
name: Warmaster's Shack

description: Waypoint Ruins consists of a group of broken buildings and abandoned campsites, now overrun with poisonous flowers and their crazed caretaker
name: Waypoint Ruins

description: A small, abandoned village nestled within a forested area north of the Castle Morne Rampart. This village is host to long-dilapidated dwellings, inhabited only by hostile Demi-humans.
name: Ailing Village

description: A busy bridge swarming with iron-clad foes. Be prepared to engage in an array of melee, ranged and artillery attacks or attempt to push past them
name: Bridge Of Sacrifice

description: A dilapidated church, presumably frequented by the former residents of Ailing Village. Now it lies in ruin, its congregation replaced by a family of mutant vermin feasting on the remains of  unfortunate travelers
name: Callu Baptismal Church

description: The Church of Pilgrimage is a broken building situated at the top of the cliff in the north of the Weeping Peninsula. Even with the walls and roof destroyed pilgrims still make the journey to visit this church
name: Church Of Pilgrimage

description: Remants of a chaos swept castle, teeming with iron-clad enemies -now engulfed with fire, piles of remains and ruin.
name: Castle Morne

description: Demi-Humans congregate here to worship their queen. Defeating her will reward players with the Demi-Human Queen's Staff, which is excellent for beginner mages.
name: Demi-human Forest Ruins

description: Earthbore Cave is a small dark cave on the side of the Cliffside between Limgrave and Weeping Peninsula. One might be able to hear the squeaks of rats and the snoring of a large beast deep within if you listen closely
name: Earthbore Cave

description: A run-down tower built on the edge of the cliffs of the Weeping Peninsula, located west of the Bridge of Sacrifice.
name: Forest Lookout Tower

description: The Impaler's Catacombs are found in the east side of the Weeping Peninsula. Once used to store the bodies of the dead, it is now crawling with Imps.
name: Impaler's Catacombs

description: The ruins of a lonely church, sitting atop a plateau west of the peninsula. Despite its current state, the altar remains intact and ghostly knights still roam the fields nearby, perhaps restless and duty-bound to safeguarding the area...
name: Fourth Church Of Marika

description: One of the large Erdtree's found in the Weeping Peninsula. An Erdtree Avatar charges at those who approach
name: Minor Erdtree (weeping Peninsula)

description: Found at the western edge of the Weeping Peninsula, this lonesome hut is home to but a single person who has long adapted to a life of seclusion
name: Isolated Merchant's Shack

description: A lone observation tower atop a plateau in the east of the Weeping Peninsula. Long since abandoned, the entrance is barred by a seal, presenting travelers with a small challenge
name: Oridys's Rise

description: A dark and hidden tunnel that is inhabited by Misbegottens and Miners.
name: Morne Tunnel

description: Hidden cave in the forest teeming with poison-filled creatures.
name: Tombsward Cave

description: The ruins of a former burial ground. Next to nothing remains here, yet squires still roam the dark tunnels beneath. Perhaps protecting the graves of their former noble masters..
name: Tombsward Ruins

description: The Tombsward Catacombs are hidden inside the mountain near the Minor Erdtree in the Weeping Peninsula. Once filled with the bodies of the dead, armed skeletons now rise to chase away those that wish to explore its depths.
name: Tombsward Catacombs

description: A dilapidated tower guarded by foot soldiers and mounted cavalry. Makeshift wooden platforms and ladders line the inside of the tower, allowing it to retain some function as a lookout point and a mount for ballistae
name: Tower Of Return

description: An evergaol located on the western landmass of the Weeping Peninsula. A formidable opponent is imprisoned within
name: Weeping Evergaol

description: A set of ruins found in western Weeping Peninsula. Overgrown with thick shrubs and poisonous flowers, this decrepit landmark invites only misery and dread.
name: Witchbane Ruins

description: The depths of the Raya Lucaria Academy are rich in rose-tinted crystals, imbued with the natural magic of the area
name: Academy Crystal Cave

description: The sunken remains of the academy town
name: Academy Gate Town

description: A small structure housing a lift that takes you down to the Ainsel River.
name: Ainsel River Well

description: A small cabin at North Liurnia of The Lakes. Its strongly perceived tranquility seems overshadowed by oblivion.
name: Artist's Shack

description: Located past the ruins and the forested area guarded by Mounted Knights.
name: Bellum Church

description: Outside the East Raya Lucaria Gate
name: Bellum Highway

description: Black Knife Catacombs homes many skeletons and crabs within its depths, find and defeat the Black Knife Assassin within to obtain their dagger.
name: Black Knife Catacombs

description: A large estate situated far to the north of Liurnia.
name: Caria Manor

description: Small cozy shack where Blackguard Big Boggart resides.
name: Boilprawn Shack

description: A large library-like location full of spectres
name: Carian Study Hall

description: A small starting building with trail leading to an area occupied by a gnarly Grafted Scion
name: Chapel Of Anticipation

description: A tower overlooking the southern-most tip of Liurnia of the lakes
name: Chelona's Rise

description: The remnants of an old church in the north of Liurnia, just before the Altus Plateau.
name: Church Of Inhibition

description: A large church atop the southern plateau of Liurnia.
name: Cathedral Of Manus Celes

Liurnia of the Lakes: A peaceful church at the back of Stormveil Castle.
name: Church Of Irith

description: It is here, at the Church of Vows, that the great houses of the Erdtree and the Moon were joined by the matrimonial bond between red-haired Radagon and Rennala of the Full Moon. That is why it holds in view the monuments of both houses, the Erdtree of the Capital and the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
name: Church Of Vows

description: A tower found on the fringe in the northeastern tip of Liurnia.
name: Converted Fringe Tower

description: An abandoned tower
name: Converted Tower

description: Evergaol located on the western landmass of Liurnia. A powerful force stirs within.
name: Cuckoo's Evergaol

description: A deep well leading to the Moonlight Altar from the underground Grand Cloister.
name: Deep Ainsel Well

description: Divine Tower of Liurnia is a Location in Elden Ring. The Divine Tower of Liurnia is found in Liurnia of the Lakes and is reached by taking the lift down at the secret area of Carian Study Hall.
name: Divine Tower Of Liurnia

description: A village in Liurnia gripped in the madness of Three Fingers. Its denizens know nothing but the fiery frenzy burning within them
name: Frenzied Flame Village

description: A massive lift platform found between Liurnia and the Altus Plateau. The mechanism that operates the lift is barred by four Guardian Statues, requiring the brandishing of a special artifact for them to release their hold
name: Grand Lift Of Dectus

description: A lone tower overlooking the Liurnia main road on the eastern landmass
name: Highway Lookout Tower

description: Jarburg was a peaceful village, but the effects of the Shattering affected even the otherwise amicable Living Jar
name: Jarburg

description: A ruined area, only seemingly bare.
name: Kingsrealm Ruins

description: Hidden on the southwestern cliffs of Liurnia of the Lakes, a winding cave carved by large crystals
name: Lakeside Crystal Cave

description: Ruins of a sunken structure beset by fog, found amidst the marshes of south Liurnia.
name: Laskyar Ruins

description: The ruins of a large estate found atop the southwestern plateau of Liurnia.
name: Lunar Estate Ruins

description: An evergaol overlooking the vast lakes. An ever burning flame resides within
name: Malefactor's Evergaol

Liurnia of the Lakes: This ancient Erdtree overlooks the lakes from the southwest
name: Minor Erdtree (liurnia Southwest)

description: Ruins found in the southwest of the Liurnia of the Lakes region
name: Moonfolk Ruins

description: The holy remains now lie in ruin
name: Purified Ruins

description: A tower beset by large chunks of glintstone emerging from the ground and penetrating its interiors. Home to a mysterious figure observing The Lands Between
name: Ranni's Rise

description: One of the vast networks of tunnels used prominently for the academy's crystal mining operation.
name: Raya Lucaria Crystal Tunnel

description: A Tower of the Three Sisters, belonging to Renna. It houses Ranni's Snow Witch Armor Set
name: Renna's Rise

description: An isolated shack north of the Minor Erdtree. Bodies litter the ground inside the shack, possibly belonging to those one has taken revenge upon
name: Revenger's Shack

description: An evergaol where a nortorious assassin is incarcerated
name: Ringleader's Evergaol

description: Catacombs at the end of the world..
name: Road's End Catacombs

description: The ruins of a former church aptly named Rose Church, for its walls are now festering with scarlet rot and overgrown with bloodroses.
name: Rose Church

description: An evergaol constructed for the Carian Royal family in the plains east of the royal estate
name: Royal Grave Evergaol

description: A steep precipice with abundant caves in the insides all the way through
name: Ruin-strewn Precipice

description: A tower bequeathed unto Preceptor Seluvis. Serves as his personal study as he delves into the sorcerous arts.
name: Seluvis's Rise

description: A small shack nestled at the side of a cliff, only accessible through a long winding cave system.   A woman and her wolf companion rest here.
name: Slumbering Wolf's Shack

description: A dark and murky cave beset by a poisonous miasma. Home to servants of rot, relishing in the presence of the giant poisonblooms endemic to the cave
name: Stillwater Cave

description: Ruined by the breaking, the Temple Quarter is now overrun with dangerous creatures, ready to attack any who come near
name: Temple Quarter

description: An observation tower found in the middle of a lone isle in Liurnia. The entrance is sealed by impish magic and presents a challenge to would-be visitors
name: Testu's Rise

description: As its name suggests, The Four Belfries is a hill with four large bell towers overlooking Liurnia from the west. Each belfry hosts a waygate that transports travelers to various locations
name: The Four Belfries

description: The cursemongers have destroyed the Village of the Albinaurics, but perhaps their hope to reach the promised city is not yet lost
name: Village Of The Albinaurics

description: Long time abandoned cave.
name: Abandoned Cave

description: A set of perpetually burning ruins in western Caelid. The Caelid Highway cuts through these ruins which are heavily guarded by mobile flamethrowers and swarming with burning reanimated corpses
name: Caelem Ruins

description: A labyrinth of Scarlet Rot-soaked floors and tunnels.
name: Caelid Catacombs

description: A set of ruins found in southwest Caelid, along the highway. Long abandoned, the ruins have become home to all manner of creatures that revel in the decay and putrefaction brought on by the scarlet rot
name: Caelid Waypoint Ruins

description: The Swamp of Aeonia is nestled in the center of the Caelid region. What were once flourishing plains filled with rich flora and fauna are now reduced to a cesspool of death and decay. A high concentration of the dreaded scarlet rot has mutated the very earth itself, twisting the creatures and plant life that once called this home.
name: Aeonia Swamp

description: The Cathedral of Dragon Communion has long been destroyed, but those who seek to commune with draconic power may yet access its power
name: Cathedral Of Dragon Communion (caelid)

description: A dilapidated church found in the cliffs east of Sellia, Town of Sorcery
name: Church Of The Plague

description: A ruined fort in a ruined land,
name: Fort Gael

description: A set of tunnels found on the western edge of Caelid, along the border to Limgrave
name: Gael Tunnel

description: The Forsaken Ruins consists of a group of broken buildings and abandoned campsites. It is located in Caelid and is gaurded by a Giant Crow
name: Forsaken Ruins

description: Found at the west of Caelid.
name: Gaol Cave

description: A lone shack found below the eastern hills near Sellia, Town of Sorcery.
name: Gowry's Shack

description: Minor Erdtree Catacombs is a Location in Elden Ring. The Minor Erdtree Catacombs is found in Caelid, beneath the Minor Erdtree. Players can reach this location by traveling east from where the region meets with Limgrave and then looking for the entrance behind the tree, in the north.
name: Minor Erdtree Catacombs

description: A small castle that is heavily guarded at the castle's outskirts by Radahn Knights and Soldiers. The Redmane Castle serves as the gathering point for warriors alike who are wanting to participate in the Radahn Festival
name: Redmane Castle

description: The Minor Erdtree of Caelid, found in the northwest near the border to Limgrave.
name: Minor Erdtree (caelid)

description: The crystal mining operation of Sellia is overseen by greedy and aggressive insectoids
name: Sellia Crystal Tunnel

description: Outside of Sellia Evergaol
name: Sellia Evergaol

description: The gateway leading to Sellia, Town of Socrcery
name: Sellia Gateway

description: A once-great town renowned for its study of the sorcerous arts. Now lying in ruin, the ghosts of its former scholars still roam the streets.
name: Sellia, Town Of Sorcery

description: The Last Church in Limgrave before reaching Caelid
name: Smoldering Church

description: An old worn-down shack overlooking a long stretch of cliffs in western Caelid.
name: Shack Of The Rotting

description: The sages of Caelid are no more, and their former district is now the dwelling of perfumers and their poisonous flowers
name: Street Of Sages Ruins

description: Catacombs for those who have died a glorious battle death
name: War-dead Catacombs

description: Capital Outskirts is a Location in Elden Ring. The Capital Outskirts sub-region lies in the Eastern area of the Altus Plateau and is the region just outside Leyndell, Royal Capital but still within the capital's outer walls. Beware of Skeletons rising from their graves and rocks flying out of the capital toward the battlegrounds when exploring the area.
name: Capital Outskirts

description: The Altus tunnels were once used to supply the lands with quality crystals
name: Altus Tunnel

description: Dominula, Windmill Village is a Location in Elden Ring. The Dominula, Windmill Village  is found in Altus Plateau. East of the "Road of iniquity Side Path"sight of grace. Follow the main path southeast then bend east.
name: Dominula, Windmill Village

description: East Pasture Outskirsts of Windmill Village. True to its name, it can be identified by the still-working windmill placed in the center of the pasture.
name: East Windmill Pasture

description: An evergaol located on within the Altus Plateau.
name: Golden Lineage Evergaol

description: Nestled on a cliff within the confines of the Royal Capital, this shack is home to a humble merchant, who has chosen a life of seclusion
name: Hermit Merchant's Shack

description: The Altus tunnels were once used to supply the lands with quality crystals
name: Altus Tunnel

description: Leyndell, Royal Capital is a Location in Elden Ring. The Leyndell, Royal Capital region is only accessible to players who have gathered two Great Runes or by following Ranni the Witch quest line and defeating Fia's Champions near the Great Waterfall Crest Site of Grace in the Deeproot Depths, and has content for highly leveled gameplay. For a detailed walkthrough, please visit the walkthrough page for Leyndell, Royal Capital Legacy Dungeon here.
name: Leyndell, Royal Capital

description: Long forgotten ruins among golden trees, swarmed with demi-humans protecting the undergound chamber.
name: Lux Ruins

description: An old mining site, still active to this day. Its tunnels echo with the grunts and groans of the commoners, tirelessly slaving away, grinding at the rich reservoir of crystals deep within
name: Old Altus Tunnel

description: What's left of the Church of the Minor Erdtree
name: Minor Erdtree Church

description: Not as small or abandoned as it looks.
name: Sealed Tunnel

description: A lonely church on a steppe
name: Stormcaller Church

description: An abandoned and Decrepit castle found in the northern region between the Mt. Gelmir and the Altus Plateau regions. The castle is half sunken into a poisonous bog, with the air tinged yellow by the fumes.
name: The Shaded Castle

description: Woodfolk Ruins, guarded by Limgrave's creatures, can be found near the Minor Erdtree within Altus Plateau.
name: Woodfolk Ruins

description: A run-down shack amidst burning corpses past the site of a recent battle.
name: Corpse-stench Shack

description: Writheblood ruins, with nearest minor erdtree in background
name: Writheblood Ruins

description: A series of long-abandoned huts found directly south of the volcano
name: Craftsman's Shack

description: Large Catacombs housing an ancient hero of Mt. Gelmir.
name: Gelmir Hero's Grave

description: An abandoned shack along the western edge of Mt. Gelmir
name: Hermit's Shack

description: Fort Laiedd is found on the western edge of Mt. Gelmir. A fort left broken, still occupied by those who won the battle
name: Fort Laiedd

description: A set of ruins found in Altus Plateau, far to the west and below Mt. Gelmir.
name: Perfumer's Ruins

description: A dilapidated village southeast of Mt. Gelmir. Now home to Demi-Humans.
name: Hermit Village

description: Sage's Cave is a dark opening in the side of a mountain. Its dark depths are overrun by hostile undead, but those who brave it may find treasures beyond compare
name: Sage's Cave

description: Second of the four Churches of Marika where players can gather a Sacred Tear for their flask.
name: Second Church Of Marika

description: A burial grounds crawling with Misbegotten creatures found deep beneath the Perfumer's Ruins. Despite its decrepit state, the catacombs give off a trace of fragrant aromas juxtaposed by the scent of the ancient dead
name: Unsightly Catacombs

description: A cave found along the Seethewater Ravine.
name: Seethewater Cave

description: Burial grounds located beneath Wyndham Ruins.
name: Wyndham Catacombs

description: A cave system at the highest point of Mt. Gelmir, made into a home by a family of Demi-Humans hiding their maddened Queen.
name: Volcano Cave

description: A large set of ruins atop a burial grounds. The reanimated dead still roam the area
name: Wyndham Ruins

description: The Beastial Sanctum is a refuge for those who feed on the dead. Beastly and deformed, the clergyman here will teach the ways of the beast to those who feed it
name: Bestial Sanctum

description: A small dungeon found beneath the Minor Erdtree in Dragonbarrow
name: Dragonbarrow Cave

description: A massive tower found in central Dragonbarrow, north of Caelid. The sides of the tower are crumbling from the massive overgrowth protruding from the plateau
name: Divine Tower Of Caelid

description: A second lift to the Siofra River.
name: Deep Siofra Well

description: Fort Faroth used to house the guardians of Caelid, but its defenders have long fallen, now bound to earth as hostile spirits
name: Fort Faroth

description: An observation tower in the northeast of Dragonbarrow, off the path to the Bestial Sanctum
name: Lenne's Rise

description: A lonesome hut found atop a plateau in western Dragonbarrow. Home to a hermit looking to part with various odds and ends... for a price
name: Isolated Merchant's Shack (dragonbarrow)

description: A castle found in the northeast of the Mountaintops of the Giants. Stronghold of Commander Niall and his spectral knights
name: Castle Sol

description: A small crumbled church high on the mountains
name: Church Of Repose

description: The giant's forge could contain a volcano.
name: Forge Of The Giants

description: The impressive Lift of Rold transports those who wield the right key. But could there be more than one destination??
name: Grand Lift Of Rold

description: Guardian's Garrison is staffed by Fire Priests, who zealously watch the road leading to the Giant's Forge
name: Guardians' Garrison

description: A complex dungeon filled with invulnerable enemies and strange golden floor seals.
name: Giant-conquering Hero's Grave

description: A lone shack found in the Mountaintops of the Giants. This shack was once visited by a traveling maiden, but she had long since perished under the elements
name: Shack Of The Lofty

description: A cave found by the Freezing Lake, heavily battered by the elements
name: Spiritcaller's Cave

description: A set of ruins found in central Mountaintops of the Giants. The plateau it is sitting on is located between two bridges.
name: Stargazer's Ruins

description: The ancient Town of Zamor, now fallen to ruin. Its anzient order of knights still roam the snow-capped streets
name: Zamor Ruins

description: The Catacombs of the fields leading to Miquella's Haligtree hide powerful secrets, but are zealously guarded
name: Consecrated Snowfield Catacombs

description: A ruined church lying in the frozen north-west of the Consecrated Grounds
name: Apostate Derelict

description: The secrets of Heretical Rise are closely guarded by hidden magic, but the tower is overrun with hostile Avionette Soldiers
name: Heretical Rise

description: The secret passage leading to Miquella's Haligtree has been polluted by Those Who Live in Dead
name: Hidden Path To The Haligtree

description: A set of ruins found in the northwest of the Consecrated Snowfield
name: Yelough Anix Ruins

description: Ghost town inhabitated in the evergaol
name: Ordina, Liturgical Town

description: An icy tunnel on the southern edge of the Yelough Anix Ruins
name: Yelough Anix Tunnel
